definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: This is probably the result of long and boring office hours, when nothing interesting happens.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是漫长无聊刻板的办公时间导致的。

sentences.english: Drop in during TA office hours.
All the clerks balloted for shortening the office hours.
sentences.chinese: 全体职员投票赞成缩短办公时间。

sentences.english: And the same thing with the office hours for the TAs.
sentences.chinese: 和助教们的办公时间是一样的。
我的办公时间是什么时候？

sentences.english: So do view these particular office hours.
sentences.chinese: 所以务必查看一下办公时间。

sentences.english: She dreamt away the office hours.
sentences.chinese: 她在想入非非中混掉办公时间。

sentences.english: And I, too, will have office hours.

definition: time of going to work/the morning rush hour
time of business/opening hours (of shop)/working time

pinyin: Chu1 ru4 Jing4 Guan3 li3 ju2

definition: to handle official business/to work (esp. in an office)
